title: Donald Trump decides not to deploy the National Guard in San Francisco
subhead: Trump had planned to make the California metropolis a symbol of a city abandoned to crime and headed for ruin under Democratic leadership, and had considered sending in the military to restore order. However, the city's mayor argued his case by highlighting the 'commonsense' approach he had taken to combat crime and drug trafficking.

title: Sarkozy imprisonment: Armed officers guarding the ex-president spark shock and outrage
subhead: On Wednesday, interior minister Laurent Nuñez defended the measure, citing Nicolas Sarkozy's 'status' and 'threats against him.' Prison guard unions decried it as 'security madness' and 'unprecedented humiliation.'

title: At Art Basel Paris, the art world shows no sign of crisis
subhead: Under the glass roof of the Grand Palais, collectors from around the world gather for the major contemporary art fair. The mood is nothing short of euphoric.

Fighting their own country: Hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians are forcibly conscripted by Russia
subhead: Moscow is pursuing a policy of forced Russification and militarization in occupied territories, aiming to turn the local population into soldiers. These Ukrainians account for one quarter of the prisoners of war held by Kyiv, Le Monde reveals.

title: Sweden's Tidö 2.0 is a 'love match' between the liberal right and the far right
subhead: 'The new faces of Europe's far right' (4/5). One year ahead of the parliamentary elections, two influential think tanks have released a Trump-inspired manifesto calling for closing public agencies, tax cuts and deregulating the labor market.

title: From 'boomers' to 'Gen Z': Where do generational labels come from?
subhead: While young activists in several countries are rallying under the 'Gen Z' banner, the concept of generations remains contentious. Its origins lie more in journalism and marketing than in science.
